bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 30, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison designates Hench as a special representative of Washington and Jefferson College to obtain manuscripts and photographs from Cuban sources for the Lazear Memorial Building.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 30, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
March 30, 1940

div1.p:
We are delighted that you are able to help
us on the dedication of the Lazear Memorial Building
at Washington and Jefferson College on October
twenty-sixth. We are inviting you to give the
address outlining the yellow fever experiment, result-
ing in the conquest of yellow fever, and the work of
the commission which achieved so much. We are
particularly anxious that you should study and give
us the story of the Finlay Institute and the story of
that great scholar and research man, Doctor Agramonte.

In order to learn of the Finlay Institute and
of the work of Doctor Agramonte, could you not make a
special trip to Havana? There you could make special
visits or contacts with Mr. Moran and others who
participated in the work and particularly with those men
of the Cuban Government who have carried on the work
begun by Doctor Agramonte. We would particularly
request that you secure from them, what I am sure they
will be proud to give you, photostatic copies of the old
records and photographs of the scenes and personalities
connected with the work of the yellow fever commission
in 1900. Is it not possible that these photographs
and records will be available in the institutions of
Havana, such as the Finlay Institute, the Medical School,
the Medical Societies, and perhaps the Public Library?
Any such copies which you are able to obtain will be
deposited in the special library of the Lazear Memorial
Building on the college campus and will remain there as a
permanent record available to American scholars, present-
ing the work of Doctor Agramonte, Doctor Reed, Doctor
Carroll, and of our own alumnus Doctor Lazear.

We commission you as special representative
of Washington and Jefferson College who gave Doctor
Lazear to Havana for this work and we know that you will
be welcomed there by the officials to whom we send our
greetings.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Cooper Hutchison Doctor Philip S. Hench
Hotel Villa Atlantique
Atlantic Avenue
Palm Beach, Florida
